text: Hi everyone, I'm having trouble validating my theme on the marketplace. I've already submitted it several times without any issues, but this time I'm unable to submit it for review. I have a file located at `/theme/modules/macros.html`, which I import into several modules using `{% import '../macros.html' %}.` However, the automatic validation process is triggering an error that says *"Theme has internal dependency",* and I'm not sure what's causing the issue. I've also tried using `../../modules/macros.html`, but it doesn't seem to work either. Any help would be appreciated. Thanks!

I'm also suddenly getting a ton of dependency errors, about files having absolute paths, with no idea how to fix it cause the files it indicates don't actually have any absolute paths in em. :confused:
However the code is just working fine for me, I'm only facing the issue when running automatic marketplace validation.
we are experiencing the same issue as well

Is the folder where you installed the theme in the root design manager folder? Looks like it's trying to find files by hitting the root and working back so if it's in /marketplace/theme then it might throw off those relative links
